p: When cultured with the skin mucus from fish fed the phytogenic-supplemented diet, a reduction on the growth of the pathogenic bacteria V. anguillarum was observed ( t-test; P < 0.05; Figures 6A,B). Growth decrease was recorded between 4 and 14 h of bacterial culture; the most accentuated decrease in growth values compared with control diet (over 30%) were found between 8 and 12 h ( Figures 6A,B). Regarding P. anguilliseptica, a decline in bacterial growth was observed in both gilthead seabream skin mucus samples from fish fed the control and phytogenic-supplemented diets ( Figures 6C,D). However, P. anguilliseptica growth decline was observed to be more accentuated in the mucus from fish fed the phytogenic-supplemented diet than in that of the control group at 12–14 h of culture ( t-test; P < 0.05), with a maximum decrease in growth of 50.2 ± 1.6% at 14 h ( Figure 6D).
